name: Safety Harbor Resort and Spa

reviews.title: 2nd Visit
reviews.text: At little late in posting my thoughts as getting back to work and catching up took some time. This recent visit, Sept 21st was my second one and once again I just cannot say enough good things. Room was clean, beds so comfortable, patio furniture clean and comfortable too. I am a Pinellas county resident so this was a staycation for me. Three lovely days and nights. The foods experience in the evening was wonderful, two nights had steak and they were cooked to my temperature preference on the first try. Chicken Piccatta the last evening was light and fresh tasting and the presentation was lovely.

reviews.title: Service to our Country Visit
reviews.text: We of course enjoyed the Spa facilities, all areas clean tidy, well kept, staff professional.

reviews.title: Fabulous place for girls getaway!
reviews.text: One cautionary note, check out spa operation hours. The indoor pool and hot tub areas have multiple signs saying the operation hours are from 6:00 am to 9:00 pm. Sign at Spa check in desk says 8:00 am, we assumed the 8:00 am meant that spa services/treatments started then because the pool and hot tub areas clearly say 6:00.am.

reviews.title: Wonderful!!!
reviews.text: That said, a lovely visit and we will make this an annual trek.

reviews.title: Fantastic! Already booked our next trip!
reviews.text: Oh goodness where to start? Jennifer at the front desk is absolutely amazing !start to finish.she helped us with questions about the hotel the history everything that we are interested in!She was there I believe from 3 to 11 and anytime you needed anything she was there!also I have to give a big shout out to Jeff the maintenance worker he helped us out so much with so many things, it wasn't real big problems but little glitches.absolutely perfect!

The first thing me and my wife got going into the hotel, there was people putting a sealer down on the tile outside of the hotel and it took our breathe away it was that bad. Made my wife sick to her stomach. The next day we had breakfast at the restaurant and the food all tasted like cardboard literaly. The same day at night we were trying to go to sleep but we couldn't because they had a band or something down stairs playing some kind of music which didn't sound like music to us but they had it so loud things were bouncing off the wall. Nothing to do really no water slides or park. Wasn't worth the stay. It was really bad
reviews.title: bad stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had an amazing stay at the Safety Harbor Resort. We can't say enough about the friendly staff, especially Mr. Richko who helped us plan our stay and made sure our accomodations were nothing but first rate. He truly went above and beyond to make sure we were completely taken care of and, as a rarity these days, seemed to thoroughly enjoy his job in doing so. We enjoyed the beautiful view, restaurant and the quintessential small city location with fun shops and views all around. The brunch was delicious and of a caliber comparable to much more expensive gourmet restaurants. Be sure to have the bread pudding with caramel sauce, it's a treat you won't soon forget. We will definitely be returning at our next opportunity for a luxuriously relaxing getaway.
reviews.title: Overall luxurious getaway

reviews.text: Because the resort sits on natural springs, almost any rain episode causes flooding. The management does not take the necessary actions to rectify the consequential mold. The building temperature throughout the resort and spa is extremely cold to attempt to keep the mold at bay. My labor day retreat was a bust as the prior day flooding had exacerbated the mold problem. While the spa services are good, the mold and musty spa environment triggered my allergic reaction. By 4pm when I got to my room in the Olympia tower, I started coughing and wheezing. Attempts to reduce mold reaction with the in-room dehumidifier unit were unsuccessful. As much as I did not want to leave, my breathing was belabored and I could not stay any longer. Moving to another room was not an option as the problem exists throughout all the resort buildings. As I checked out at 6pm, the same day as arrival, the front desk woman asked me to call back after the labor day weekend when a manager would be present. I willingly paid for the spa services delivered. The result...a ridiculous $27 refund on a $200 room. I will never go there again. So sad that this prior legacy to healing is degraded, over priced, and dangerous to your wallet and health.
reviews.title: MOLD Everywhere with no refund

reviews.text: Still among the fewest with a relaxing atmosphere, all of its own. You can see and sense that everything is not brand new, but everything is very well maintained. Pool is huge and has a nice pool side bar that is open late. Rooms - ours were on the ground floor - are huge and very nice. You get a separate vanity room inbetween the room itself and the bathroom. A nice touch.
reviews.title: Not the newest, but still amonst the fewest.
Happy Birthday Dicksie!
reviews.text: Location is great: right on Tampa Bay waterfront.

reviews.title: Overall Good Stay but Less than Expected
reviews.text: Safety Harbor is a nice little town in a convenient location. At first glance, the hotel seemed very luxurious but proved to be slightly less than we had expected.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First, the front desk wasn't able to find our room. We had reserved a King room poolside and they checked us into a room with two queen beds. They assured us that they would be able to "find" a room for us, but after waiting nearly an hour while they paid little to no attention to us, we settled on the room with two queen beds.
reviews.title: NEVER AGAIN!

reviews.text: The pool area was very nice and we loved having a poolside room with a walkout patio but overall the hotel just didn't have the luxury resort feel that they try to make it out to be.
reviews.title: It's lost it's magic

reviews.text: We did not utilize the spa so I can not comment on that. In fairness, it could be a spectacular experience.
reviews.title: Historic gem on Tampa Bay

reviews.text: My wife and I have been coming to the Safety Harbor Resort and Spa for over 4 years and we have always looked forward to our relaxing getaways. Safety harbor is a wonderful town and the people we have met relaxing at the pool over the years were very friendly and classy. Jackie at the front desk could manage a five star resort and her greeting upon arrival has always made us feel very welcome. Fortunately for us! NOT for Jackie she is the last good thing left at the resort.
reviews.title: Luxury?? Maybe the Spa, but definitely not the "Resort"

reviews.text: See my other other reviews for more information about this property.
reviews.title: Another Year, Another Week at Safety Harbor Resort and Spa
Good Stay but needs updating and better amenities for the "spa experience" it portrays.
reviews.text: This year's room was in in the Palm Pavilion. Nice bay view, but the room smelled very musty upon entering. The odor seemed to dissipate once the A/C got going.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was clean and very spacious. Bed is very comfortable. House-keeping was very pleasant and efficient. I do think this room needs a carpet update soon.
reviews.title: Beautiful Florida Spa with a pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Concerns: Toward the end of the week, the A/C started to get very loud to the point of waking me up several times. The hot water was never really hot even when turned all the way to hot. Lighting in the room is poor. Cell phone signal is poor in many areas of the property.
reviews.title: Day spa visit

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Improved: banquet service has improved immensely! The shuttle driver was very pleasant.
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay good location as well

description: The historic Safety Harbor Resort and Spa is located on 22 acres of pristine waterfront along Tampa Bay. In addition to the 50,000 square foot spa & fitness center, the resort also offers over 30,000 sqft of flexible meeting and banquet space - perfect for any conference or wedding.
